Issues.Title: fix(core): handle empty translations correctly
Issues.Body:
In certain use-cases it's useful to have an ability to use empty strings as translations. Currently Ivy fails at runtime if empty string is used as a translation, since some parts of internal data structures are not created properly. This commit updates runtime i18n logic to handle empty translations and avoid unnecessary extra processing for such cases.

Fixes #36476.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(core): handle empty translations correctly" (#36499)

Issues.Title: fix(upgrade): update $locationShim to handle Location changes before ‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶initialization

Updates the $locationShim to receive the most recent Location change
made, even if it happened before initialize() is called. This is
important when AngularJS bootstrapping is deferred and there is a delay
between when $locationShim is constructed and when it is initialized.
With this change, the $locationShim will correctly reflect any redirects
that occurred between construction and initialization.

Closes #36492

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
**There weren't any unit tests for the existing behavior and it appears that the test mocks aren't set up well for testing Location changes. I tried for a bit to make it work, but that seemed like a large separate change that needs to happen.**
- [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)
**No doc changes are needed because the external API isn't changing**


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->
Any Location changes (for example the results of redirects) that happen between $locationShim being constructed and initialized are dropped. This can lead to the onChange function being called with incorrect values. There are also some style changes from running the code formatter.

Issue Number: #36492


## What is the new behavior?
Any Location changes (for example the results of redirects) that happen between $locationShim being constructed and initialized are taken into account. This means that incorrect onChange events won't be emitted.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information

Issues.Title: [Reactive Forms] - Text Input has focus, (click) event doesn't fire for buttons generated with *ngFor over dynamic array
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package @angular/forms ### Is this a regression? Unknown ### Description Generating a form with reactive forms. While a reactive input has focus, clicking buttons fails when the buttons are generated via an *ngFor over a dynamic getter on the component. If I generate the buttons based on the `rawProviders` property, those buttons work. Also, if I remove the reactive forms `[formGroup]` and `[formControlName]` from the form/input elements, the issue goes away. I've verified that this happens on both `ng serve` and the results of an `ng build` component.ts ```ts export class AppComponent { @ViewChild('log')log: ElementRef; form = new FormGroup({ name: new FormControl('initial', [Validators.required, Validators.minLength(3), Validators.maxLength(64)]) }); rawProviders = ["Google", "Facebook"]; //PROBLEM HERE get providers() { const ret = []; this.rawProviders.forEach(p => { ret.push({ name: p }) }); return ret; } onClick(event: Event, provider: string) { const log = this.log.nativeElement; log.innerHTML += `onClick(${event}, ${provider})\r\n`; } constructor() { } } ``` component.html ```html
Name:
Repro Steps:

1. Focus the Name input field above

2. Click a button below

raw array - first click of button while name has focus works


getter - first click of button while name has focus doesn't raise DOM event. The second click works (after first click changes focus from name)


``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Above in working reproduction: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-fklrqm While the Name input has focus, clicking the 'raw array' buttons works as expected, but clicking the 'getter' buttons doesn't fire the `(click)` event. ## üî• Exception or Error No exception ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 9.1.0
Node: 12.11.1
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 9.1.0
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router

Issues.Title: $locationShim.onChange writes wrong url when redirects are used with deferred bootstrapping
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
The issue is caused by package @angular/common/upgrade


### Is this a regression?
No, this behavior never worked


### Description
The $locationShim has an option to provide the AngularJS $injector as a promise which means that the [initialize](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/6de4cbdd4141ac3ade2fcc3fffb3a18e75978460/packages/common/upgrade/src/location_shim.ts#L71) will be run when that promise resolves. Now that we are deferring the bootstrapping of AngularJS we run into a situation where the $locationShim is initialized after the Location.onUrlChange listeners have been notified.

If the user is navigating to a URL that redirects (for example /hello redirecting to /hello/world) then we see that $locationShim emits an onChange event for /hello when it shouldn't be. This is because a call to $location.search in the AngularJS side of our application triggers the $locationShim to call composeUrls  which thinks there has been a change from /hello/world to /hello.


## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction
This reproduces within a complex dual bootstrapped application within Google. I have a fix for the issue so I'm just posting this bug report for tracking purposes.

## üåç  Your Environment

**Angular Version:**
Running at head
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "$locationShim.onChange writes wrong url when redirects are used with deferred bootstrapping" (#36492)

Issues.Body:

Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)

What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes

## What is the current behavior?
Currently if someone need to enable/disable a Form Control from a boolean variable, it's necessary to write:

```
if (someBoolean) {
  control.enable();
} else {
  control.disable();
}
```

## What is the new behavior?

With this proposal, we can just do

```
  control.setEnable(someBoolean);
```

Issues.Title: perf(ngcc): read dependencies from entry-point manifest
Issues.Body:
Previously, even if an entry-point did not need to be processed,
ngcc would always parse the files of the entry-point to compute
its dependencies. This can take a lot of time for large node_modules.

Now these dependencies are cached in the entry-point manifest,
and read from there rather than computing them every time.

See https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/36414\#issuecomment-608401834
FW-2047
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(ngcc): read dependencies from entry-point manifest" (#36486)

Issues.Title: Ivy doesn't validate unknown attributes/properties
Issues.Body:
Previously I compiled my app using ViewEngine in AOT mode. So I received error about missing directives in template. For example, if I do next: `
` And that was useful, so I received message, that I forgot to import some module, where some directive is defined. Now, when I moved to Ivy, it does type check, for known parameters, but it just ignores any unknown directive, which I forgot to import. Is this expected behavior? P.S. In tsconfig.json I had and still have next: ``` "angularCompilerOptions": { "skipMetadataEmit" : false, "skipTemplateCodegen": false, "strictMetadataEmit" : true, "strictInjectionParameters": true, "fullTemplateTypeCheck": true, "strictTemplates": true, "enableIvy": true }, ``` Even tried to extend with ``` "strictInputTypes": true, "strictNullInputTypes": true, "strictAttributeTypes": true, "strictSafeNavigationTypes": true, "strictDomLocalRefTypes": true, "strictOutputEventTypes": true, "strictDomEventTypes": true, "strictContextGenerics": true, "strictLiteralTypes": true ``` but without any difference.

Issues.Title: Support dynamic ids in @angular/localize
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/localize


### Description

I know in-code translations using the global `$localize` are still an unofficial feature. However it is a very useful way for me to do translations in code. E.g. 
```
$localize`:@@OTHER_DAYS:days`
```
One use-case which is not covered is, if I get the translation id via an external API. Then I have the translation id stored within an variable. 
It would be helpful, to be able to call `$localize` with an id stored in a variable. E.g.

```
let translationId = // get from external API
let defaultText = //
$localize`:@@${translationId}:${defaultText}`
```

As far as I understand the current implementation will interpret the first placeholder as part of the text and will fail building. 

<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...


### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> If you have a solution in mind, please describe it.
An option to hand over the translation id stored in a variable to a `$localize` call.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?
I have tried to build the arguments manually, but this fails when doing a production build:

```
localize(id: string, value: string) {
    let ra: ReadonlyArray<string> = [':@@' + id + ':', ''];
    ra['raw'] = [':@@' + id + ':', ''];
    let tsa: TemplateStringsArray = <TemplateStringsArray>ra;
    return $localize(tsa, ...value);
}
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Support dynamic ids in @angular/localize" (#36480)

Issues.Title: Attribute in deps stopped working with Ivy
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/core ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 8 ### Description You can use `Attribute` decorator in `deps` for providers like this: ``` { provide: TOKEN, deps: [[new Attribute('token')]], useFactory: factory, } ``` It stopped working with Ivy and Angular 9 ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Working Angular 8: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-attribute-deps Broken Angular 9: https://ng-run.com/edit/hyppU3cXJCaRYLYVDAQp ## üî• Exception or Error 

R3InjectorError(AppModule)[[object Object] -> [object Object] -> [object Object]]: 
  NullInjectorError: No provider for [object Object]!
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 
9.1.0

Issues.Title: [Angular 9 - i18n] Cannot use empty strings as translations anymore
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package `@angular/localize` and/or Ivy (not sure). The crash happens here: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/416c786774dccc20d824737207be4e55cb53c9cc/packages/core/src/render3/hooks.ts#L74 ### Is this a regression? Yes, the last previous version in which this bug was not present was: Angular 8.2.14. ### Description When translating an app in different locales, it may be wanted to translate some strings to `""`. With Angular 8, it was possible to let some translation `` with empty value in XLIFF 1.2 files. The result would be an empty HTML element. But with Angular 9, it seems not possible anymore. When a `` is left empty and the corresponding bundle generated, [the app crashes at this line](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/416c786774dccc20d824737207be4e55cb53c9cc/packages/core/src/render3/hooks.ts#L74) when the page containing the empty target is rendered: TypeError: Cannot read property 'directiveStart' of null Please note that this crash only happens when the empty `` concerns an HTML tag content. When the empty `` concerns an HTML *attribute* translation, the app won't crash. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Minimal reproduction available at: https://github.com/bravier/ng9-i18n-empty-xliff-target I've generated this example using `ng new myapp` and added `@angular/localize` using the [official documentation](https://angular.io/guide/i18n). The `i18n` tagged span is [here](https://github.com/bravier/ng9-i18n-empty-xliff-target/blob/2cd013ac5f5e225895269fce9f34d874aceac5c8/src/app/app.component.html#L308). Build steps: - `npm install` - `npm run build` - `http-serve dist/myapp` - Navigate to the `/fr/` build and look at the console. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 9.1.0
Node: 10.15.0
OS: linux x64

Angular: 9.1.0
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, localize, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Issues.Title: Enable capturing while listening to an event using output property binding like (blur)
Issues.Body:
Hello All,
I have developed a component which is simply a wrapper over input box say 
<my-input></my-input>
Now when I am using blur and focus event on created webcompoennt in angular like

**<my-input (blur)="method"></my-input>**

but my method is not getting called.
I came to know that it requires *capturing* enabled which can be done by :

myinput.addEventListener('blur', function () {}, *true*)
I have researched a lot but haven't found any support for this.

Can someone help me ?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Enable capturing while listening to an event using output property binding like (blur)" (#36475)

Issues.Title: Dev builds in Angular 9 are very slow
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, not present in 8.2. ### Description Dev builds in Angular 9 are _very_ slow. Builds of 8.2 took on average 30 seconds or so, and recompiles took 2-5 seconds. This same app in Angular 9, however, takes ~45-60 seconds to build initially, and recompiles take ~15-25 seconds even if nothing changes at all. Production builds are roughly 5-10 seconds faster in 9, so those are better at least. (Note that none of these times include `ngcc`, that's taken care of before I attempt to build.) Additionally, the speed is slow regardless of whether Ivy is used or not. The Angular 9 build always seems to freeze for a bit at a certain point. It frequently lists the same file, but it's not always the same file that it seems to get stuck on. There's nothing special about the file it usually lists, it's actually quite small and has no advanced Angular or TypeScript features. I found #34699 (and #33532 by extension), but those are unrelated. I'm using TS 3.8 and it happens regardless of the value of that option in `tsconfig.json`. Is there a way I can audit what's causing it to take so long? I tried `ng build --watch --verbose`, but it provides way more information than I can feasibly parse (and also doesn't include timings from what I can tell). ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction I'm running `ng build --watch` in both Angular 8 and 9. This is a work app so I can't share it, and I can't provide a repro because I don't know what's causing it to happen in the first place. ## üî• Exception or Error N/A ## üåç Your Environment

OS: win32 x64

Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [x] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Description When creating a new project through `ng new `, the following rgba is set in line 123 in `app.component.html`: `box-shadow: 0 4px 17px rgba(black, 0.35);` Chrome is not applying the box shadow since it is an _invalid property value_: ![Wrong rgba value](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41572666/78650997-fd2ea280-78bf-11ea-99c4-85bbf0aee21f.png) Edge does so as well. Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Description I have an application that is being translated in several (21 at the moment) languages using the Angular i18n mechanism. I'm compiling the app AOT, therefore I need a separate build for each locale. To achieve this I setup my Azure pipeline to build the app using multiple agents in parallel, one for each locale, and it works like a charm. However, this is very resource-consuming, so I'm updating to Angular 9 in order to use the `--localize` option, which perfectly fits my needs. After the update I can build the app once and translate it to all languages in a few seconds, which is amazing. I am now facing this issue: when I build my application for all locales, the resulting chunk hashes are identical. As a result, browser cache is not invalidated and files are not re-requested, so the app is not translated. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction - clone this [repo](https://github.com/nas90/i18n-hash-issue) - run `npm install` - run `ng build --localize` - check the dist folder: file content for `main.js` is different for each locale (template text is translated), while the hashes are the same ## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 9.1.0
Node: 10.19.0
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 9.1.0
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, localize, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

-----------------------------------------------------------

@angular-devkit/core              9.1.0

@schematics/angular               9.1.0
@schematics/update                0.901.0
rxjs                              6.5.5
typescript                        3.8.3
webpack                           4.42.0
**Anything else relevant?** In my scenario, the user language preference is stored in the cookies, and a shell app serves the corresponding folder. I can't add the locale to the URL. Therefore in my `angular.json` I set `baseHref="/"` for all locales. I am aware of this [issue](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/16526) and the [PR](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/pull/16817) mentioned there, however the issue is still not resolved.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "localized components containing i18n tags will produce identical chunk hashes when building with --localize" (#17416)

Issues.Title: Compiling ivy with aot leads to "ERROR in Maximum call stack size exceeded"
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes and no. Version 8 and 9 without ivy work just fine. However ivy has problems with aot. ### Description After updating existing Angular project from version 8 to 9, compilation with ivy and aot leads to "ERROR in Maximum call stack size exceeded". Non-ivy compilation works fine with or without aot with all optimization options. Also ivy WITHOUT aot works fine regardless of optimization options. After much work I have isolated the problem to a module containing a highly mutually interdependent classes. More specifically if any class is imported from that module aot compilation crashes. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction I have separated the troublesome module from the larger project and created a minimal test bench and can share it via github private repo on request. ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: Ability to generate multiple index.html files
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request
Ability to build multiple index.html

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [ ] new
- [X] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability...
I am working on solution for multi branding app where every branch requires a unique theme with some brand specific configuration. Now in order to support this there is a brand specific environment configuration in place and a separate build needs to be triggered. This is all going good but the problem is as the number of brand grows maintaining branch specific environment and build is getting tedious considering the fact that every brand will also require dev,qa,prod specific configuration. 


### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> If you have a solution in mind, please describe it.
The solution that i am looking for is to be able to generate multiple index.html files for each brand from the build with the respective theme reference. I can then use this output in a webserver where i can route it respective index.html based on the domain 

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds?
I can achieve this by extending the web pack configuration or using gulp but it will be more of workaround rather than a solution as i have to make copies of index.html and also replace the references. It will be nicer to have this feature come from angular cli
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Ability to generate multiple index.html files" (#17409)

Issues.Title: using image [src] with require to load images requires .default suffix
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: angular & cli <9.1.0 ### Description binding image [src] to a source using "require()" longer works unless ".default' suffix is present; ex: ```ts export class TestComponent { sun = require('./sun.svg'); // [...] ``` ``` html ``` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. setup the test app ```bash ng new test-app curl -Ll https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/e8/Heraldic_Sun.svg -o ./test-app/src/app/sun.svg cd test-app ng serve ``` 2. edit app.component.ts ```ts import { Component } from '@angular/core'; declare const require: any; @Component({ selector: 'app-root', templateUrl: './app.component.html', styleUrls: ['./app.component.scss'] }) export class AppComponent { sun = require('./sun.svg'); } ``` and replace app.component.html with ```html ``` ## üî• Exception or Error there will be no exception however rather than requiring the img a request to http://localhost:4200/[object%20Module] will be made; changing the require like this: ```ts sun = require('./sun.svg').default; ``` works however previously it worked without this; this gets fixed if [file-loader's esModule](https://webpack.js.org/loaders/file-loader/#esmodule) is set to false which i did using a custom angular-builders/custom-webpack like this ```js const isImgLoader = (rule) => rule.test && rule.loader && rule.test.toString().includes('svg') && rule.loader.toString().includes('file-loader'); const patchFileLoader = (rule) => ({ ...rule, options: { ...rule.options, esModule: false, // <------ here }, }); module.exports = (config) => { return { ...config, module: { ...config.module, rules: config.module.rules.map((r) => isImgLoader(r) ? patchFileLoader(r) : r ), }, }; }; ``` ## üåç Your Environment 



Angular CLI: 9.1.0
Node: 12.16.1
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 9.1.0
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic

**Anything else relevant?** of course it can be fixed adding this change in packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/angular-cli-files/models/webpack-configs/common.ts i might check this later and add a PR [vue](https://github.com/vuejs/vue-loader/issues/1612) had smth similar

Issues.Title: ng build --prod removes 'var' variables from css file
Issues.Body:
Hello,
I have an Angular project.

My css looks like :

`
:root{
	--table-row:#f3f3f3;
	--table-shadow:#9EA1A2;
	--execution-log-background:#000;
	--tooltip-arrow:#24272A;
	--invalid-ele-border:#ff6170;
}
.invalidElement input.ng-invalid,
.invalidElement textarea.ng-invalid{
    border: 1px solid var(--invalid-ele-border) !important;
    border-radius: 3px !important;
}`

When I run command for production version:_ng build --prod=true --deleteOutputPath=true --optimization=true --progress=true --showCircularDependencies=true_


it results as (from dist folder):

:root{--white:#fff;--theme-red:#bc0134;--bright-green:#73d94b;--bg-light-gray:#eeeeee;--bg-med-gray:#dddddd;--bg-dark-gray:#cecece;--bg-green:#d5f3c9;--bg-light-red:#ffe2ea;--bg-switch:#cccccc;--menu-divider:#a8a8a8;--text-dark-gray:#4c4c4c;--text-med-gray:#777777;--text-light-gray:#999999;--text-icon-green:#47ad33;--btn-icon-gray:#bbbbbb;--border-gray:#ddd;--border-dark-gray:#999;--border-light-red:#d5aab6;--shadow-light-red:#d5aab640;--disabled-bg:#eee;--disabled-text:#666666;--disabled-btn-text:#c3c3c3;--transparent:rgba(0,0,0,0);--trans-black:rgba(0,0,0,0.1);--focus-border-red:#d8bdc4;--focus-shadow:red;--focus-input-border:#999999;--trans-white:#ffffffad;--bg-tooltip:#444;--bg-used:#c0dedd;--table-row:#f3f3f3;--table-shadow:#9EA1A2;--execution-log-background:#000;--tooltip-arrow:#24272A;--invalid-ele-border:#ff6170}**.invalidElement input.ng-invalid,.invalidElement textarea.ng-invalid{border:1px solid!important;border-radius:3px!important}**

Here u can see in result **var(--invalid-ele-border)** is missing property form css.

So why this is happening, In a development environment, it works perfectly fine.

Note: **extractCss** parameter can solve my problem, but it increases files in the dist folder. So I don't want to go with it.

Please help..

Thank You

Issues.Title: material-moment-adapter doesn't work in build-angular@0.901
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report Class with @angular/material-moment-adapter not opening in production build @angular-devkit/build-angular@0.901.0 version. It worked without problems until version @angular-devkit/build-angular@0.900.7 ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? ### Description Class with @angular/material-moment-adapter not opening in production build @angular-devkit/build-angular@0.901.0 version. It worked without problems until version @angular-devkit/build-angular@0.900.7 ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction **1) Update build-angular@0.901 and material-moment-adapter** npm i @angular-devkit/build-angular@0.901.0 @angular/material@9.2.0 @angular/material-moment-adapter@9.2.0 **2) Import material-moment-adapter into the page.** import { MAT_MOMENT_DATE_FORMATS, MomentDateAdapter, MAT_MOMENT_DATE_ADAPTER_OPTIONS } from '@angular/material-moment-adapter'; import { DateAdapter, MAT_DATE_FORMATS, MAT_DATE_LOCALE } from '@angular/material/core'; **3) Add providers to the page.** @Component({ providers: [ { provide: MAT_DATE_LOCALE, useValue: 'en-US' }, { provide: DateAdapter, useClass: MomentDateAdapter, deps: [MAT_DATE_LOCALE, MAT_MOMENT_DATE_ADAPTER_OPTIONS] }, { provide: MAT_DATE_FORMATS, useValue: MAT_MOMENT_DATE_FORMATS } ] }) **4) Production build** ng build --prod **5) After running the app, Page does not open.** **6) Downgrade build-angular@0.900.7** npm i @angular-devkit/build-angular@0.900.7 **7) Production build** **8) After running the app, It runs without problems.** ## üî• Exception or Error

Issues.Title: refactor: decouple migrations from CLI devkit
Issues.Body:
We want to refactor our update-tool to no longer rely
on specifics from the Angular CLI devkit. This has various benefits:

* Ability to run migrations inside Google.
* Ability to run migrations in a standalone tool (for people not using the CLI)
* No tight dependency on the CLI devkit API. We could easily switch tools if needed.
* Ability to wrap migrations in tslint rules (or other tools if needed).

Additionally, this PR fixes an issue with Bazel on Windows where runfiles no longer can be resolved. This is because `rules_nodejs` symlinks the workspace into the `@npm` repository now, and resolving runfiles through relative paths no longer works.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor: decouple migrations from CLI devkit" (#19014)

Issues.Title: help(SnackBar): Electron and Snackbar don't work well together
Issues.Body:
<!--------

The Angular team can't provide general troubleshooting help. However, the extended community of
users can provide more help: 

StackOverflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/angular-material2
Gitter: https://gitter.im/angular/material2
Google Groups: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/angular-material2

Issues should capture only bug reports and feature requests. However, we understand that 
it is not always clear whether an issue is caused by a bug or incorrect usage of a feature/component.

Most support requests will be automatically closed. If the answer is quickly obvious, though, we 
might be able to provide a brief answer.

-------->


#### What are you trying to do?

I'm building an Electron Desktop application using Angular Material. When communicating with the back end of the app to get information, sending it to the front end of the app and displaying that data via snackbar. To listen for the event on the front end (getting the data from the back to the front) I use the listener for `ipcRenderer` like so

```ts
this.ipc.render.on('test', (e, res) => {
	snackbar.open(res, 'close')
})
```

this works somewhat. For some reason, it auto-positions it to the top left. Clicking the action button will make it snap to the default original position or to the position in the config, if you have one set. Then the action button will do nothing after this, after clicking anywhere on the app except the action button, it'll disappear. If there is no action button set, it will not disappear.

#### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?
The first line in this example down below will work perfectly fine and will use the config. The one inside the listener wont apply the config until after the action button is clicked and then clicked outside of it (as stated before) 
```ts
snackbar.open(res, 'close', config)
this.ipc.render.on('test', (e, res) => {
	snackbar.open(res, 'close', config)
})
```


#### Reproduction

I have tried to recreate this in StackBlitz as at first I thought it was having trouble updating the view or communicating with the service and components, but it seems to be between Electron and snackbar specifically (all other components don't have troubling relaying data from Electron).
  
I can make a git here soon for reproduction (I recreated a lot of my app from the ground up to only hit this again)
#### Environment

- Angular: 9.0.7
- CDK/Material: 9.2.0
- Browser(s): Electron/Chromium
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "help(SnackBar): Electron and Snackbar don't work well together" (#19011)

Issues.Title: bug(cdkScrollingModule): No list-items using server-side-rendering (angular-universal)
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
When using angular-universal's server-side-rendering in combination with the `cdkScrollingModule` the rendered html-document returned by the server never contains any list-items.

_Reason why this happens:_  
During the rendering process on the server the variable `elementRef` in the component `cdkVirtualScrollViewport` has no property called `clientHeight` nor `scrollTop`.

As a result the method `updateRenderedRange` sets `scrollOffset` and `viewportSize` to _undefined_ which leads to a wrong renderedRange.

#### What is the expected behavior?
There should be a (configurable) fallback value if those essential properties are missing, so the document that is sent to the client contains at least some list-elements.

#### What is the current behavior?
The rendered document does not contain any list-items.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. Set up an angular-universal app
2. Import the ScrollingModule of `@angular/cdk`
3. Disable the execution of JavaScript on the client (that only the html-document returned by the server is shown)
4. Request the page containing the list

#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
Due to the server-side-rendering the user sees the website much faster (while the angular-application still loads) but it only shows an empty list which is not quite useful.  
As a result the whole performance-boost brought with angular-universal is lost.

#### Environment
Angular: 9.1.0
CDK/Material: 9.2.0
Browser(s): Chromium 80.0.3987.162
Operating System: Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(cdkScrollingModule): No list-items using server-side-rendering (angular-universal)" (#19012)

Issues.Title: bug: Memory Leaks on several material components ?
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/edit/github-x9pcfz

Hello, I have an application where I make massive use of material components and I found that my application had memory leaks. 

I created an empty Angular 8.2.14 application and imported inside some material components that I use to test them. Here is what the application looks like:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32635415/78660797-0292e980-78ce-11ea-93e1-c8d3c107b0bd.png)
Source code here: https://stackblitz.com/edit/github-x9pcfz

For each components I implemented with Selenium a test scenario containing interactions that are repeated 1000 times. Here are the list of interactions for each tested components:
- `mat-ripple`: Tap the `RIPPLE` button.
- `mat-menu`: Tap the `OPEN MENU` label and then tap `MENU ITEM`  in the opened menu to close the menu.
- `mat-slide-toggle`: Tap twice `SLIDE TOGGLE` to switch states.
- `mat-checkbox`: Tap twice `CHECKBOX` to switch states.
- `mat-radio`: Tap twice `RADIO` to switch states.
- `mat-stepper`: Tap three times `NEXT` button to go across the 3 steps.
- `mat-slider`: Tap `MINUS` button to decrease slider and then tap `PLUS` button to increase the slider.

Before testing a component 1000 times, Chromium is restarted with following option: `-js-flags=--gc-global=true, --expose-gc=true` in incognito mode.
The test wait 1 second after each tap.
At the end of each iteration, the test record the current JS heap size using `window.memory.usedJSHeapSize`.
Each 10 iterations, `window.gc()` is performed to force Major Garbage Collector and then the test wait 60 seconds.
(Yes it took 15 hours to run those tests.)

Here the graph we can plot from the heap size for each scenarios:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32635415/78662153-3707a500-78d0-11ea-88fd-78d13307192f.png)

A more friendly graph with polynomial smoothing:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32635415/78662104-222b1180-78d0-11ea-85e2-cecf5137d549.png)

My goal here is not to make finger pointing, I like Material since it is pretty simple to use. I am opened to any suggestions to make my tests more reliable or to change the way I am using material components.
 
#### Expected Behavior

Memory to be stable over time and not increasing.

#### Actual Behavior

Memory seems to increase for each tested components.

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.14
- CDK/Material: 8.2.3
- Browser(s): Chromium 78.0.3904.108
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug: Memory Leaks on several material components ?" (#19010)

Issues.Title: bug(Mat-icon/Mat-Stepper): Accessibility issue whiel reading Mat-icon
Issues.Body:
JAWS Screen reader is having issues while reading the content on 2nd step.

Steps to reproduce:
1. create stepper on page with three steps on it
2. On first step add field with mat-icon, icon should clickable with dynamic aria label

 
 
#### Expected Behavior
JAWS screen reader has option to read all the content of page. while reading content on 2nd stepper it should not read the content of 1st step.

#### Actual Behavior
JAWS screen reader is reading the mat-icon aria label of 1st stepper in 2nd stepper. This happen only in case when screen reader reads the total content of the screen(insert+v)

https://angular-material-7-sandbox-en8aoh.stackblitz.io/
##### Detail Explaination

We are using angular material stepper. On first page of stepper, JAWs is reading all the fields correctly. First page has a field with Icon . Field is having dynamic aria-label which can change on some condition. 
 
On read all (insert + down arrow), Its reading field and clickable icon of it along with icon Aria label. So no problem here.
Problem starts on 2nd page, when user filled the information on 1st step and moved to 2nd step(fill your address). When start read all(insert + down arrow). Its reading aria label of icon on first step(not whole page only icon).
Those icons(aria-label) are not present 2nd step even. This is happening only when aria-label is dynamic not when aria-label is static.
The same issue on 3rd step. Its reading dynamic aria-label of icon on first page and second page.

#### Environment

- Angular: 7.3.7
- CDK/Material:7.3.7
- Browser(s):
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental/mdc-chips) Replace default values
Issues.Body:
mat-chip-grid implements ControlValueAccessor. Its default value
right now is undefined; once a chip is added, its value is an array
of all the chip values. The default value for a given chip is all the
text content inside the chip. For chips with icons, this causes the
icon text to be included in the value, so a row chip using matChipRemove
would have a value like " hello cancel ". (There's also some unwanted
whitespace in the textContent).

Replace undefined with an empty array, and the textContent with just
the actual chip text, which in the case of row chips corresponds to the
text that the user entered.

These unintuitive values are the same as the old non-mdc
mat-chip-listbox. But due to the way the old listbox implemented
ControlValueAccessor, chips being used as a chip grid didn't actually
ever call the onChange handler to update the FormControl value, so their
values were basically ignored.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material-experimental/mdc-chips) Replace default values" (#19006)

Issues.Title: bug(drag-drop + virtual scroll): Draggable item loses its position when new list item is rendered in the DOM as a result of virtual scrolling
Issues.Body:
### Reproduction The problem comes up with you mix together drag-and-drop and virtual scroll functionality. [Here's the stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/fork/angular-ixqfux) that demonstrates the problem. I've painted the placeholder element into green. **I've done a lot of debugging to figure out the cause of the problem and I'll describe my findings below.** Steps to reproduce: 1. Configure component view to use both drag-and-drop and virtual scrolling ```
{{item.id}}
 ``` 2. Star dragging an element down. ### Expected Behavior A draggable item is always rendered where I keep a mouse pointer. ### Actual Behavior As new elements are being rendered to the DOM, the draggable item loses its position and either disappears or starts jumping in the list. ### Environment - Angular: 9.0.5 - CDK/Material: 9.2.0 - Browser(s): Chrome - Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows ### Demo of the problem: ![2020-04-06_14-50-54](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6124091/78556550-d6b52c80-7817-11ea-82da-50c0caa4f7b9.gif) ### My investigation The cause of the problem seems to be the new items that are being rendered. Once an item is added to the DOM, the `CdkDrag` directive attached to it [registers itself within a drop list container](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/d1a6ea74db0881001bf02ff113f269552effc4f6/src/cdk/drag-drop/directives/drop-list.ts#L197). This in turn leads to the `withItems` method being triggered on the drop container list: ![image (2)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6124091/78557328-3eb84280-7819-11ea-82ed-738bfeb860e4.png) As the callstack unfolds, the [cacheItemPositions](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/531ea7cc5b2a6c13daac59c3b33f00ff1147efe7/src/cdk/drag-drop/drop-list-ref.ts#L606) method is called. The problem is that inside this method all current item positions (offsets) are reset to 0. If you add a logging to the method before and after `this._this._itemPositions` are updated: ``` this._itemPositions.forEach(item => console.log('Element ID:', item.drag.data.element.nativeElement.id, 'offset:', item.offset)); ``` this is what the console shows: ![2020-04-06_14-58-16](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6124091/78557564-aec6c880-7819-11ea-92fe-3ecfe98d7bc3.jpg) This leads to a placeholder element lose current position and start jumping in the list. **I'm happy to make a PR to fix it, if I get guidance on the best way to address this problem.**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(drag-drop + virtual scroll): Draggable item loses its position when new list item is rendered in the DOM as a result of virtual scrolling" (#19003)

Issues.Title: bug(drag-drop): `Point` interface is not exported in the public API
Issues.Body:
#### Issue
The `Point` interface:
```ts
/** Point on the page or within an element. */
export interface Point {
  x: number;
  y: number;
}
```
is defined and exported inside [drag-ref.ts](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/cdk/drag-drop/drag-ref.ts). This interface is used in the public drag-drop API, e.g.
```ts
@Input('cdkDragConstrainPosition')
constrainPosition: (point: Point, dragRef: DragRef) => Point
```

But `Point` is missing from the [public-api.ts](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/cdk/drag-drop/public-api.ts) exports.

```ts
export {DragRef, DragRefConfig} from './drag-ref';
```

...should include `Point` as well.

```ts
export {DragRef, DragRefConfig, Point} from './drag-ref';
```

#### Environment

- Angular:
- CDK/Material: 9.2
- Browser(s):
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(drag-drop): `Point` interface is not exported in the public API" (#19001)

Issues.Title: bug(cdkTextareaAutosize): Animation of height calculates default height wrongly
Issues.Body:
I have a component, A, which contains a textarea, which has the attribute cdkTextareaAutosize.

When I animate the height of A from 0 to * (i.e. the default height). The height of A is animated to the wrong final value which appears like the default height assumes that the height of the textarea is only one line and not the number of lines it actually has.

As soon as the animation completes, the height jumps to the right height.

Therefore I guess, that there is a kind of synchronization problem between computing the height of the textarea by the cdkTextareaAutosize attribute and determining the default height for '*'.

Any hint?

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.14.
- CDK/Material: 8.2.3.
- Browser(s): Google Chrome.
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  Windows 10 Pro
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(cdkTextareaAutosize): Animation of height calculates default height wrongly" (#18999)

Issues.Title: Combined Input and Select Broken
Issues.Body:
When you combine `<input>` and `<mat-select>` using `<mat-form-field>`, the result is broken when `<mat-select>` **precedes** `<input>`.

However, things work as expected when `<mat-select>` **follows** `<input>`.

#### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce: https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular9-material-combined-select-input
  
#### Expected Behavior

When combined, `<input>` and `<mat-select>` should behave independently.

#### Actual Behavior

When `<mat-select>` **precedes** `<input>`:

Clicking the `<input>` activates the `<mat-select>`'s drop down.

Moreover, you're unable to select the `<input>` using the mouse. Tab selecting the `<input>` does work however.

#### Environment

- Angular: 9.1.0
- CDK/Material: 9.2.0
- Browser(s): Chrome 80.0.3987.149 (Official Build) (64-bit) 
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Combined Input and Select Broken" (#18998)

Issues.Title: fix(youtube-player): unable to bind to events after initialization
Issues.Body: The `youtube-player` component is set up so that it won't bind any events if there aren't any listeners at the time the player is created. This makes it impossible to bind an event by getting a reference to the player using `ViewChild` and subscribing to it. These changes fix the issue using a lazy observable which binds any events once the user subscribes and transfers them between players.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(youtube-player): unable to bind to events after initialization" (#18996)

Issues.Title: Form-Field `input` and `label` DOM order issue
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal:
According to WCAG [H44: Using label elements to associate text labels with form controls](https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG20-TECHS/H44.html)
> Check that there is a label element that identifies the purpose of the control **before** the input, textarea, or select element

In the Material [form-field](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/material/form-field/form-field.html#L24) component, the `label` is **after** the `input`

#### What is the expected behavior?
The Material [form-field](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/material/form-field/form-field.html#L24) renders the `label` **before** the `input` in the DOM according the the WCAG.

#### What is the current behavior?
The form field component renders the `label` **after** the `input` in the DOM. Accessibility tests are failing because of this, and it is likely why JAWS and NVDA weren't reading the labels. IE, `aria-owns` is likely unneeded if the DOM order were corrected.

#### What are the steps to reproduce?
1. Use a [form-field](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/master/src/material/form-field/form-field.html) component in your project


#### What is the use-case or motivation for changing an existing behavior?
Accessibility and WCAG compliance. You will likely be able to remove the superfluous `aria-owns` attribute as a result, as well.

#### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected?
All of them, I believe... At least 5.X and up.

#### Is there anything else we should know?
That is all. Thank you!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Form-Field `input` and `label` DOM order issue" (#18989)

It is not about serving or building. It is only about developing. The error is only shown in the IDE (webstorm) but does not appear in the serve or build process.
